context_of_use: This use case allows a power user to securely access the system by registering an account, logging in, and resetting their password.
description: Allows users to register, log in, and reset their passwords to access the system securely.
triggering_event: Power user initiates the authentication process.
preconditions: The power user must have internet access.
The power user must have valid credentials for registration or login.
postconditions: The power user is successfully authenticated and can access the system.
The power user's account information is updated if registration or password reset occurs.
assumptions: The power user has the necessary information to register or reset their password.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to register an account.
The system shall allow users to log in securely.
The system shall allow users to reset their password.
main_flow: 1. power user → System prompts for registration details.
2. power user provides registration details → System creates a new account.
3. power user → System prompts for login credentials.
4. power user provides login credentials → System authenticates the user.
5. power user → System grants access to personalized features.
6. power user requests password reset → System prompts for email verification.
7. power user provides email → System sends password reset link.
8. power user follows link and sets new password → System updates the password.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If registration details are invalid, System displays an error message and prompts for correct details.
EF-2 (from Step 4): If login credentials are incorrect, System displays an error message and prompts for re-entry.
EF-3 (from Step 7): If email is not registered, System displays an error message and prompts for re-entry.
